review_blob: Completely amazing.  One of my favorites for a long time.  Citrusy, huge flavor, balanced palate.

Filled corny at the brewery.  Tasted on tap at home.

Glowing reddish brown.  Crystal clear.  Beautiful pillowy head.  Aroma is malt and herbal hops.  Taste includes sherry, molasses, herbal hops.  Palate is balanced, maybe a tad on the malt side.  Little hop presence.  Head remained thick halfway down the glass with great lacing throughout.

Appearance:  Opaque brown with orange at the edges.  A rough pour generates an off-white fingers width head that dissipates relatively quickly.

Smell:  Malt, caramel, molasses, apple, even candy sweetness

Taste:  Alcohol is fairly forward on the tongue with an overwhelming malt sweetness followed by a fuselly alcohol and herbal hop finish

Palate:
